metadata.title: CVE-2014-9036 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in WordPress before 3.7.5, 3.8.xbefore 3.8.5, 3.9.x before 3.9.3, and 4.x before 4.0.1 allows remoteattackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted CascadingStyle Sheets (CSS) token sequence in a post.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9036` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentythirteen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.1+dfsg-1').
